meanings.definition: A person who refuses to obey rules or commands.
meanings.sent1: The disobedient disobeyer was always getting in trouble at school.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the disobedeyer for not following the classroom rules.
meanings.sent3: The little disobeyer thought it was funny to ignore bedtime and stay up late.
meanings.sent4: The stubborn disobeyer was like a wild horse, refusing to be tamed by anyone.
meanings.sent5: The disobedeyer stood out in the crowd, boldly challenging authority at every turn.

meanings.definition: To refuse or fail to obey rules or commands.
meanings.sent1: She would often disobeyer her parents by sneaking out of the house at night.
meanings.sent2: The dog would always disobeyer when told to come inside from the yard.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to disobeyer its programming, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to disobeyer the weather forecast, bringing unexpected rain.
meanings.sent5: The toddler would constantly disobeyer, testing the limits set by his caregivers.
